channel.title: Client Server Web Application Development
channel.description: Client Server Web Architecture includes REST inspired APIs, significant JavaScript client side processing and Java or other server side language (many of which are available on the Java Virtual Machine).

item.title: REST Inspired Pragmatic Web-API Design
item.description:
REST as defined by
Roy Fielding
exerts a wide influence yet is seldom adopted in toto

item.title: Most Popular JavaScript MVC Frameworks
item.description:
Your selection of a JavaScript MVC framework can be based on many factors (including specific framework functionality,
in-house skills of your development team, and your experiences with previous projects)

item.title: Quick JavaScript Debugging Tricks
item.description: Java developers generally do their work in a cycle of code, build (compile), execute

item.title: The Quiet Revolution
item.description:
Andrew Binstock over at Dr. Dobb's
recently described a "revolution" in programming - specifically a revolution that is requiring significant changes to the way programmers work

item.title: Angular and IE7
item.description: AngularJS is a great framework but there is some ambiguity on their site related to support for old versions of IE

item.title: InfoQ Interview on Client Server Web App Development
item.description: InfoQ has an interview with James Ward who spoke in the last year at JavaOne and OSCON on Client Server Application Development with HTML5 and Java
